item.title: Noise constrastive estimation
item.description: Documenting my note why studying Noise-contrastive estimation paper. The paper proposed a method to estimate the probability density function of a dataset by discriminating observed data and noised draw from a some distribution. Notation $p_d(x)$ true probability density function (p.d.f) of data. $p_n(x)$ p.d.f of noise generating distribution. $r(x) = \frac{1}{1+\exp(-x)}$ sigmoid function. $X = (x_1, … x_T); x \sim p_d(x)$ be the dataset of T observations. $Y = (y_1, … y_T); y \sim p_n(y)$ be the dataset of T artificially generated noise.
